HIS powerful intelleot was ill supplied with knowledge. Of this he had no more than a man ean acquire while he is a student at college. The stock of general information which he brought with him from Cambridge, extraordinary for a boy, was far inferior to what Fox possessed, and beggarly when oom- pared with the massy, the splendid, the various treasures laid up in the large mind of Burke. He had no leisure to learn more than what was necessary for the purposes of the day which

was passing over him.
